summary: The Military PFAS Transparency Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of Defense to submit annual reports to Congress detailing funding and status of Department of Defense's interim remedial actions concerning perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS).  It requires a remediation acceleration strategy including prioritization criteria, timelines, and resource allocation. The bill also mandates a public, online dashboard to provide transparent information on PFAS-related activities, including funding, remediation status, and contact information.
